intro: Microula pseudotrichocarpa var. pseudotrichocarpa, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and pale green to yellowish foliage. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It has adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions through features such as succulent leaves and deep root systems. This species is often found in sandy soils and plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion.
